meanings.definition: A small metal projectile shot from a firearm.
meanings.sent1: The police officer found a bullet at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: The bullet flew through the air and hit the target.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped a bullet in my cereal this morning.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like bullets, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The shiny bullet gleamed in the sunlight, ready to be fired.

meanings.definition: A point or item in a list that indicates importance or separation.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to highlight the main points with a bullet.
meanings.sent2: The bullet on the map marked the location of the treasure.
meanings.sent3: I added a bullet to my shopping list for milk.
meanings.sent4: His decision was the bullet that changed the course of history.
meanings.sent5: The bullet on the sign caught my attention immediately.

meanings.definition: A dot or symbol used in typography to separate items in a list.
meanings.sent1: The document had bullet points to organize the information.
meanings.sent2: She used a bullet to separate each idea in her essay.
meanings.sent3: The email had a bullet next to the important message.
meanings.sent4: The bullet on the screen guided the audience through the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The bullet in the text drew my eyes to the key details.
